Instance.description: Vet Clinic Diagnosis Situation is the user-facing situation between vet and pet.

TunableTuple.name: _progress_meter_settings
TunableTuple.description: The meter used to track the progress of the diagnosis.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may NOT require tokens.

TunableList.name: _threshold_data
TunableList.description: List of thresholds for this meter.

TunableVariant.name: color
TunableVariant.description: Color of meter at this specified threshold. Note: alpha value is not used. (This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a Color tuning snippet.)

Tunable.name: hex_code
Tunable.description: An ARGB color in hex, same as one would use in HTML. A leading '0x' or '#' is allowed but not required. You can omit the alpha, in which case opaque is assumed.

Tunable.name: a
Tunable.description: alpha value (0-255) (0 is transparent, 255 is opaque)

Tunable.name: b
Tunable.description: blue value (0-255)

Tunable.name: g
Tunable.description: green value (0-255)

Tunable.name: r
Tunable.description: red value (0-255)

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a Color tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: threshold_value
Tunable.description: Value at or above which this threshold exists.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may NOT require tokens.

Tunable.name: auto_update_on_stat_change
Tunable.description: If set, the meter will automatically update when the associated stat changes. Unset this for cases when you want the situation to control when the meter changes.

Tunable.name: stat
Tunable.description: Statistic this meter is based off of.

TunableTuple.name: _stress_meter_settings
TunableTuple.description: The meter used to track the stress level of the patient.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may NOT require tokens.

TunableList.name: _threshold_data
TunableList.description: List of thresholds for this meter.

TunableVariant.name: color
TunableVariant.description: Color of meter at this specified threshold. Note: alpha value is not used. (This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a Color tuning snippet.)

Tunable.name: hex_code
Tunable.description: An ARGB color in hex, same as one would use in HTML. A leading '0x' or '#' is allowed but not required. You can omit the alpha, in which case opaque is assumed.

Tunable.name: a
Tunable.description: alpha value (0-255) (0 is transparent, 255 is opaque)

Tunable.name: b
Tunable.description: blue value (0-255)

Tunable.name: g
Tunable.description: green value (0-255)

Tunable.name: r
Tunable.description: red value (0-255)

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a Color tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: threshold_value
Tunable.description: Value at or above which this threshold exists.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may NOT require tokens.

Tunable.name: auto_update_on_stat_change
Tunable.description: If set, the meter will automatically update when the associated stat changes. Unset this for cases when you want the situation to control when the meter changes.

Tunable.name: stat
Tunable.description: Statistic this meter is based off of.

Tunable.name: audio_sting_on_symptom_discovery
Tunable.description: The sound to play when a symptom is discovered.

TunableTuple.name: pet_job
TunableTuple.description: The job and role which the pet Sim is placed into.

Tunable.name: role_state
Tunable.description: A role state the sim assigned to the job will perform

Tunable.name: situation_job
Tunable.description: A reference to a SituationJob that can be performed at this Situation.

Tunable.name: undiscovered_sickness_text
Tunable.description: Text to use if a sickness is undiscovered.

Tunable.name: undiscovered_symptom_text
Tunable.description: Text to use if a symptom is undiscovered.

TunableTuple.name: vet_job
TunableTuple.description: The job and role which the vet Sim is placed into.

Tunable.name: role_state
Tunable.description: A role state the sim assigned to the job will perform

Tunable.name: situation_job
Tunable.description: A reference to a SituationJob that can be performed at this Situation.
